item.title: 英国零售商协会（BRC）称，黑色星期五前英国零售销售增长放缓
item.description: 英国零售商协会（British Retail Consortium）称，由于购物者在政府即将公布的预算案出台前以及对 "黑色星期五 "优惠活动的期待，英国 10 月份的零售销售增长有所减弱。【原文：UK retail sales growth weakened in October, the British Retail Consortium said, as shoppers held back on purchases ahead of the government’s upcoming budget and in anticipation of Black Friday deals.】

item.title: 索尼股价因大片动漫提升利润而上涨
item.description: 索尼集团公司的股价预计将上涨，因为这家日本娱乐和电子公司受到了包括动画电影《恶魔猎手》在内的近期热门影片的提振。【原文：Sony Group Corp. shares are forecast to gain as the Japanese entertainment and electronics company gets a boost from recent hit titles including the anime movie Demon Slayer.】

item.title: 比特币矿商 CleanSpark 发行 10 亿美元可转换债券
item.description: CleanSpark 公司正在寻求通过出售可转换债券筹集 10 亿美元，这家比特币矿商和数据中心运营商正努力为其不断扩大的业务范围提供资金。【原文：CleanSpark Inc. is looking to raise $1 billion in a sale of convertible bonds, as the Bitcoin miner and data center operator seeks to fund its growing footprint.】

item.title: 油价稳定，价差收窄表明油价将趋于稳定
item.description: 由于交易商跟踪疲软的市场指标，并等待可能提供有关全球即将出现过剩的线索的报告，石油价格保持稳定。【原文：Oil steadied as traders tracked softening market metrics and waited for reports that may give clues about an impending global surplus.】

item.title: 日本财报超出预期，表明涨势将进一步扩大
item.description: 在人工智能需求增长、关税影响小于预期以及日元疲软的影响下，越来越多的日本公司盈利超出预期，这表明股市的反弹还将继续。【原文：More and more Japanese companies are beating earnings expectations on growing AI demand, the smaller-than-expected impact of tariffs and the weak yen, in a sign the rally in equities can go further.】

item.title: 澳大利亚消费者对经济前景信心大增
item.description: 澳大利亚 11 月份的消费者信心指数飙升，因为家庭对经济前景更加乐观，这一结果可能会进一步降低近期降息的可能性。【原文：Australia’s consumer confidence soared in November as households turned more positive on prospects for the economy, a result that’s likely to further reduce the chances of a near-term interest-rate cut.】

item.title: 金价上涨暂时掩盖了中国通货紧缩的痛苦
item.description: 黄金是投资者抵御通胀的传统保值工具，但在中国，飙升的金银价格却产生了相反的效果，为通缩压力提供了暂时的喘息机会。【原文：Gold is a traditional hedge against inflation for investors but in China surging bullion prices are having the opposite effect, providing a temporary respite from deflationary pressures.】

item.title: 泰克与盎格鲁的竞争对手进行了长达两年的谈判
item.description: 在同意与英美资源集团（Anglo American Plc）合并之前，加拿大矿业公司泰克资源有限公司（Teck Resources Ltd. ）已与竞争对手进行了两年的并行谈判。【原文：Before it agreed to merge with Anglo American Plc, Canadian miner Teck Resources Ltd. had been in parallel talks with a rival suitor for two years.】

item.title: 哥伦比亚通胀率跃升至 13 个月新高，超出预期
item.description: 哥伦比亚的消费价格创下了一年多来的最快涨幅，这为不顾政府呼吁放松货币政策的决策者提供了支持。【原文：Colombian consumer prices rose at the fastest pace in more than a year, bolstering the case of policymakers who are defying the government’s calls for monetary easing.】

item.title: 亚洲投资者受到美国结束停摆计划的鼓舞：市场综述
item.description: 由于美国参议院计划结束有史以来最长的政府停摆，重新激发了投资者的风险偏好，亚洲股市有望追随华尔街的涨势。【原文：Asian stocks were primed to track Wall Street gains as a US Senate plan to end the longest-ever government shutdown renewed investors’ appetite for risk.】

item.title: 增长乏力削弱泰国振兴国内旅游业的努力
item.description: 泰国南部沿海省份 Trang 拥有郁郁葱葱的岛屿和翡翠洞穴，但长期以来一直被邻近的外国游客热点普吉岛和甲米所掩盖。【原文：The southern Thailand coastal province of Trang boasts lush islands and an emerald cave but has long been overshadowed by neighboring foreign tourist hotspots Phuket and Krabi.】

item.title: 英特尔人工智能主管卡蒂离职，前往 OpenAI 担任硬件职务
item.description: 英特尔公司（Intel Corp.首席技术与人工智能官萨钦-卡蒂（Sachin Katti）已离开英特尔，前往 OpenAI 任职，负责这家初创公司的基础设施工作。【原文：Intel Corp. Chief Technology and AI Officer Sachin Katti has left the company to take a role at OpenAI, where he’ll work on the startup’s infrastructure efforts.】

item.title: 特朗普的 2,000 美元关税 "红利 "标志着 Covid 支票的回潮
item.description: 唐纳德-特朗普总统提出的从关税中向美国公民邮寄 2000 美元 "红利 "的想法，标志着科维德危机期间发放刺激经济支票的倒退，具有类似的经济风险。【原文：President Donald Trump’s idea of mailing $2,000 “dividend” payments from tariffs to US citizens marks a throwback to the stimulus checks distributed during the Covid crisis, with similar economic risks.】

item.title: 网络攻击让朝日陷入困境，竞争对手酿酒商却后来居上
item.description: 在日本准备迎接最繁忙的啤酒消费季节之际，这家日本最大的啤酒生产商却在为继续供应啤酒而苦苦挣扎；在一次网络攻击破坏其供应链一个多月后，其系统仍处于瘫痪状态。【原文：As Japan gears up for its busiest beer-drinking season, the country’s largest brewer is struggling to stay on tap — with its systems still crippled more than a month after a cyberattack disrupted its supply chain.】

item.title: 韩国新交易所考虑用 K-Pop 代币吸引更多交易者
item.description: 这家韩国主要证券交易所的新晋挑战者正寄希望于新产品，如与 K-pop 歌曲授权相关的数字代币，以巩固其良好的开端并扩大吸引力。【原文：The upstart challenger to South Korea’s main stock exchange is banking on fresh offerings, like digital tokens linked to K-pop song licenses, to build on its strong start and broaden appeal.】

item.title: 温克艾沃斯的双子座加密货币交易所因亏损而下跌
item.description: 由泰勒-温克艾沃斯和卡梅隆-温克艾沃斯创办的加密货币交易所双子座空间站公司（Gemini Space Station Inc.【原文：Gemini Space Station Inc., the crypto exchange founded by Tyler and Cameron Winklevoss, reported a steeper loss than analysts anticipated in its first earnings release since going public.】

item.title: C3.ai 在报道称软件公司正在探索出售后上涨
item.description: 据路透社报道，数据分析软件制造商 C3.ai Inc.【原文：C3.ai Inc., a maker of data-analysis software, gained after Reuters reported the company is exploring a sale.】

item.title: 人工智能公司竞相扩张，CoreWeave 利润率趋紧
item.description: CoreWeave Inc. 公布的第三季度利润率有所收窄，因为这家云计算公司正在努力扩大基础设施，为更多客户提供服务。【原文：CoreWeave Inc. reported narrower profit margins in the third quarter as the cloud computing company races to expand its infrastructure and serve more customers.】

item.title: 业务和抵押贷款增长推动 CBA 盈利增长
item.description: 在企业和家庭贷款增长的支持下，澳大利亚联邦银行第一季度的利润有所增长。【原文：Commonwealth Bank of Australia’s profit rose in the first quarter, supported by growth in lending to businesses and households.】

item.title: 魁北克省长推动 4960 亿加元养老金在国内投资
item.description: 魁北克省省长弗朗索瓦-勒戈尔（Francois Legault）表示，随着加拿大适应美国贸易壁垒的新现实，他希望该省的养老基金能更多地投资于本地，包括在制造业下注。【原文：Quebec Premier Francois Legault said he wants the province’s pension fund to invest more locally, including making bets in the manufacturing sector, as Canada adjusts to a new reality of US trade barriers.】

item.title: 风险最高的 CLO 证券提供五年来最低的回报率
item.description: 德意志银行（Deutsche Bank AG）的数据显示，风险最高的企业贷款支持债券的投资者目前得到的回报率是五年来最低的，有些投资者甚至得不到任何回报。【原文：Investors in the riskiest slice of bonds backed by corporate loans are now getting their lowest payouts in five years, while some get none at all, according to Deutsche Bank AG.】

item.title: 受降息押注影响，新西兰元即将抹去 2025 年涨幅
item.description: 新西兰元即将成为今年首个抹去对美元汇率涨幅的主要发达市场货币，原因是央行激进的降息措施在经济不景气的情况下打压了市场情绪。【原文：New Zealand’s dollar is on the verge of becoming the first major developed-market currency to wipe out its gains against the greenback this year as aggressive central bank interest-rate cuts weigh on sentiment amid a faltering economy.】

item.title: 纳斯达克正在 "增兵 "以应对 ETF 股票类上市潮
item.description: 在美国监管机构表示将允许资产管理公司将 ETF 作为现有共同基金的份额类别发售后，纳斯达克公司正在招聘人员，以在潜在的上市潮中抢占先机。【原文：Nasdaq Inc. is hiring to get ahead of a potential wave of listings after US regulators signaled they’ll allow asset managers to offer ETFs as share classes of existing mutual funds.】

item.title: 年底将至，关门终局重振美国 IPO 前景
item.description: 结束美国政府停摆的协议势头越来越猛，这刺激了人们的希望，更多的首次公开募股最快将在感恩节前出炉。【原文：The increasing momentum behind a deal to end the US government shutdown is spurring hope that more IPOs will trickle out as soon as before Thanksgiving.】

item.title: 美国称布莱恩-卡恩因预言对冲基金倒闭而被起诉
item.description: 根据美国法院的一份文件，Franchise Group Inc. 前负责人布莱恩-卡恩（Brian Kahn）被指控共谋实施证券欺诈，与一家对冲基金的倒闭有关，检察官称该基金的倒闭使投资者损失了 2.94 亿美元。【原文：Brian Kahn, the former head of Franchise Group Inc., has been charged with conspiracy to commit securities fraud related to the collapse of a hedge fund that prosecutors say cost investors $294 million, according to a US court filing.】

item.title: 纳什维尔机场管理局计划发行 13 亿美元债券
item.description: 纳什维尔机场管理局计划在 1 月份出售 13 亿美元的债务，以满足前所未有的增长需求；这也预示着明年市场上将出现大额交易。【原文：Nashville’s airport authority plans to sell $1.3 billion of debt in January to meet unprecedented growth — an offering that also bodes well for the broader market to see large deals next year.】

item.title: First Brands 为何引发华尔街众多担忧？
item.description: 最近几周，华尔街因一家汽车零部件供应商的倒闭而受到震动，该公司因借贷和会计行为受到质疑而申请破产，负债超过 100 亿美元。First Brands Group 的倒闭使包括杰富瑞金融集团公司（Jefferies Financial Group Inc.【原文：Wall Street has been shaken in recent weeks by the collapse of an auto-parts supplier that filed for bankruptcy with more than $10 billion in debt after questions arose about its borrowing and accounting practices. The unraveling of First Brands Group has ensnared major financial firms, including Jefferies Financial Group Inc., that had lending and other financial arrangements with the company.】
